intro: Staphisagria requienii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive purple center. The plant has palmate leaves that are deeply divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Staphisagria requienii is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
